meanings.definition: The main stem of a tree.
meanings.sent1: The trunk of the tree was thick and sturdy.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel climbed up the trunk of the oak tree.
meanings.sent3: The trunk of the tree swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The trunk of the tree stood tall like a pillar in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The trunk of the tree was covered in rough bark.

meanings.definition: A large suitcase or box for storing clothes and personal belongings.
meanings.sent1: She packed all her clothes in the trunk for the trip.
meanings.sent2: The trunk in the attic was filled with old photo albums.
meanings.sent3: The trunk in the bedroom was overflowing with toys.
meanings.sent4: The trunk served as a treasure chest for the pirate party.
meanings.sent5: The trunk was heavy with all the winter clothes.

meanings.definition: The elongated, muscular proboscis of an elephant.
meanings.sent1: The elephant used its trunk to pick up the peanuts.
meanings.sent2: The baby elephant played with its trunk in the water.
meanings.sent3: The trunk of the elephant sprayed water all around.
meanings.sent4: The trunk of the elephant curled up like a spiral.
meanings.sent5: The trunk of the elephant was surprisingly dexterous.

meanings.definition: The main part of a person's body, not including the head, arms, or legs.
meanings.sent1: He placed his hands on his trunk and took a deep breath.
meanings.sent2: The dancer moved gracefully, swaying her trunk to the music.
meanings.sent3: The trunk of the body held the beating heart inside.
meanings.sent4: The trunk of the body was covered in colorful tattoos.
meanings.sent5: The trunk of the body was strong and well-defined.
